Issues.Title: Cleanup VisualStyleInformation interop and add tests
Issues.Body:
- Avoid allocated a large `StringBuilder`. Instead use a stackallocated span. 512 is an appropriate size for stack allocation
- Move to the `Interop.XYZ` model to match .NET Foundation interop guidelines
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Cleanup VisualStyleInformation interop and add tests" (#1012)

Issues.Title: Add VisualStyleElement tests
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add VisualStyleElement tests" (#1011)

Issues.Title: Make DesignerActionHeaderItem public
Issues.Body: This is public in System.Design.dll
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Make DesignerActionHeaderItem public" (#1010)

Issues.Title: Remove all Instances of System.Configuration and Rework any DPI-related switches
Issues.Body:
From email thread:

> In .NETCore we donâ€™t recommend the use of app.config (none of the framework types honor its settings) nor does machine.config exist. 

> App.config doesnâ€™t flow into AppContext since CoreCLR doesnâ€™t read app.config.  AppContext still exists and you can access the values via the API.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove all Instances of System.Configuration and Rework any DPI-related switches" (#1007)

Issues.Title: [Loc]The description under "Details" after clicking it is not localized in warning dialog
Issues.Body:
**.NET Core Version:** .NET Core: 3.0.100-preview6-011904 from Master branch
**Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?:** No
**More info:** This issue also can reproduce with all 13 local languages: CHS, CHT, CSY, DEU, ESN, ITA, JPN, KOR, PLK, PTB, RUS, TRK, FRA

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Install the .NET Core 3.0 SDK from https://github.com/dotnet/core-sdk for Master branch.
2. Open the attachment .NET Core app in VS: [WarningDialog.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3189751/WarningDialog.zip)
3. Run it and edit the **Size** field to value '120,' in the property grid.
4. Observe a warning dialog to popup.

**Actual behavior:** 
The description under "Details" is not translated in .Net core.
![Core](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/57900243-b0e70800-7892-11e9-93fa-63a86860f804.PNG)

**Expected behavior:**
The description under "Details" should be translated in .Net core. Following is the screenshot of .Net framework, it is translated.
![Framework](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/57900262-b8a6ac80-7892-11e9-922b-1e7b2163e235.PNG)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Loc]The description under "Details" after clicking it is not localized in warning dialog" (#1002)

Issues.Title: [master] Update dependencies from dotnet/arcade
Issues.Body: Replaces https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/990.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[master] Update dependencies from dotnet/arcade" (#1005)

Issues.Title: Refactor ResolvedMatchingContract calculation
Issues.Body:
Changes to the build caused ResolveMatchingContract to run after
conflict resolution which was removing the desktop reference to
System.Drawing in preference to the one in the NETCoreApp refs.

Avoid this completely by directly setting ResolvedMatchingContract
using the path to the targeting pack package.

Alternative to https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1005 that doesn't include arcade update.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Refactor ResolvedMatchingContract calculation" (#1006)

Issues.Body: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10677481/57948083-8f3b5000-7895-11e9-9267-857dafad0edc.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Loc]The text for OK and Cancel buttons is not completely localized or is localized differently compared to Desktop Framework in warning dialog" (#1004)

Issues.Title: [.Net Core] MaskedTextBox.GetPositionFromCharIndex() and MaskedTextBox.GetCharIndexFromPosition() methods return the incorrect values
Issues.Body:
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**OS:** RS4 X64
**VS:** Dev16 16.2.0 Preview 1.0 [28913.52.d16.2]
**.NET Core:** 3.0.100-preview6-011867 from Master branch

**More Info:**
This issue can repro in TextBox control too, but RichTextBox control works well. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
1.	Install the .NET Core 3.0 SDK from https://github.com/dotnet/core-sdk for Master branch.
2.	Open the attached â€˜.NETCoreTestcaseâ€™ .NET Core app in VS.
3.	Start it and observe the returned values from GetPositionFromCharIndex() and GetCharIndexFromPosition() methods in debugging result.
[NETCoreTestcase.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3181261/NETCoreTestcase.zip)

**Actual:** 
Both of the returned values are 0. 
![NETCoreResult1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864985/57755075-8a09c400-7722-11e9-8808-8ae8954e189c.png)

**Expected:** 
These two methods should return the correct values, like it works in .NET Framework. 
![NETFrameworkResult1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864985/57755100-98f07680-7722-11e9-9ceb-8ba5bb274729.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[.Net Core] MaskedTextBox.GetPositionFromCharIndex() and MaskedTextBox.GetCharIndexFromPosition() methods return the incorrect values" (#994)

Issues.Title: [.Net Core] ComponentDesigner is not fully ported
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.0-preview6-27712-03
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**
ComponentDesigner currently has not implemented methods PreFilterAttributes and PreFilterEvents.
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/ComponentModel/Design/ComponentDesigner.cs#L225

And I have a question about IDesignerFilter methods implementation in ComponentDesigner. Shouldn't it call the corresponding virtual methods? (the way it's done in the .NET Framework)

**Actual behavior:**
Throws NotImplementedException

**Expected behavior:**
Implemented :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[.Net Core] ComponentDesigner is not fully ported" (#989)

Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.0-preview6-27712-03
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

I'm facing a problem that EventHandlerService is not implemented in .net Core. 
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/EventHandlerService.cs

It's called from the ComponentTray ctor which we use in our application
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/ComponentTray.cs#L102

**Expected behavior:**
Implemented :)

Issues.Title: When will WinForms fully support VB.NET in .NET Core 3.0?
Issues.Body: I'm currently trying to convert a .NET Framework WinForms app over to .NET Core 3.0. I'm in the process of converting my class libraries to .NET Standard 2.0. After installing the `Microsoft.Windows.Compatibility` NuGet package to try to get Windows-specific functionality back, I'm getting type errors for WinForms controls like Buttons, Labels, GroupBoxes. i.e. `Type 'System.Windows.Forms.Button' is not defined`. Any idea of when this will be resolved? Is this an issue with the compatibility NuGet package?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "When will WinForms fully support VB.NET in .NET Core 3.0?" (#974)
